intro: Kibera supina, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Kibera supina is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
